# didChangeNotification

**Type Property**

Posted whenever a font collection is changed.

## Declaration

```swift
class let didChangeNotification: NSNotification.Name
```

## Discussion

The notification’s object is the font collection that was affected. The notification’s `userInfo` dictionary contains information about the the collection change containing the keys defined in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFontCollection/UserInfoKey] and the corresponding values.

## Responding to Changes

- **NSFontCollection.UserInfoKey**: These constants are used as keys in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFontCollection/didChangeNotification] `userInfo` dictionary to indicate the changes that have taken place.
- **NSFontCollection.ActionTypeKey**: The following actions are possible values of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFontCollection/actionUserInfoKey] in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFontCollection/didChangeNotification] `userInfo` method.
